intro: Tenoria falcata, commonly known as the sickleleaf tenoria, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, sickle-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, temperate climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
